name: Tallinn
appearance: A middle-aged man with a hardened, world-weary look. He carries himself cautiously, dressed plainly, blending easily into criminal or working-class environments.
personality: Cautious, tight-lipped, pragmatic, and emotionally reserved. Despite his criminal connections, he is capable of genuine attachment and loyalty to those he trusts.
background: Tallinn operates on the fringes of the underworld and is familiar with criminal codes, contacts, and euphemisms. He had an ongoing working relationship with Lucifero, maintained through money and discretion. Although their relationship was professional, Tallinn genuinely regarded Lucifero as a friend. Learning of Lucifero’s death affected him deeply. He is knowledgeable about certain underworld terms and structures but avoids unnecessary exposure.
goals: Avoid drawing attention from criminal organizations
Protect himself by limiting what he reveals
secrets: He knows that the code word "the docks" is used exclusively within the Mafia
He is aware that Lucifero claimed to be a messenger from hell

clues.clueText: Lucifero was extremely cautious and only dealt with people she trusted.
About two months before Lucifero’s death, she claimed to have defeated someone and seized a troublesome prize.
The term "the docks" is an internal Mafia code word.

relationships.history: They worked together discreetly for money, but over time Tallinn came to regard Lucifero as a genuine friend.
Tallinn enjoys provoking Kovind by calling him "little mouse," treating it as casual amusement.

notes: Tallinn withholds information unless investigators gain his trust or approach him through proper underworld channels.
